title: Ian Thorpe - Beneath the Suit!
description:
Ian Thorpe -- Beneath the Suit!

Ian started training at 8 years & was allergic to cholorine. Perhaps the most important thing nobody mentions on this DVD is the tremendous competitive advantage he gets from his Australian Size 17 feet! (That means REALLY HUGE! and off any size chart or size converter system which go up to maybe 12 or 13 -- 15 max!)

Youngest ever individual male world champion swimmer at 14, making him the fastest 14-year-old male swimmer in history.

First ever winner of 6 six gold medals in one world championship.

5 Olympic gold medals -- most won by any Australian.

11 World Championship golds.

13 individual long-course world records.

Young Australian of the Year in 2000.

4 Commonwealth Games gold medals.

World record setter for 200 m & 400 m freestyle.

Quit swimming in 2006 because of "waning motivation" -- about the same time Brazilian swimmer Daniel Mendes became his housemate. They started out as "training partners" before becoming "friends." Thorpe's manager says they're "just mates". (Ask an Aussie to translate that for you.)

Ian was a great swimmer but this DVD comes close to being a puff piece about what a nice guy he is "and so great with children" but there is some good training material as well.

Any DVD Converter split this into more than a dozen files. Combining them into one file with WinAVI would cause a substantial loss in quality so I've kept the files separate and put most of them (not all) in a folder zipped with WinRAR. Nothing else was added to the folder, no ads, no links, no promo, no nothin -- just Ian Thorpe.

Chapters of the DVD include:

Profile
  Career highlight
  Achievments
  Statistics
  Photo library

Freestyle
  Warm up
  The stroke
  The start
  The turn
  Strength training
  Swimming for life

Poolside
  My inspiration
  Goal setting
  Achieving success
  Eating for success
  Drug use in sport

Beneath the suit
  Fashion
  Music
  Travel
  Fountain for youth

Xtras
  The making
  DVD-Rom

I left out stuff I didn't like but kept the cool "Matrix" style special camera effects showing his dive as well as his training tips. You get more freedom to select what to watch this way.

In ian_thorpe.rar You get:

achieving_success.avi    20,215 KB
career_highlights.avi    32,319 KB
drug_use_in_sport.avi    19,458 KB
eating_for_success.avi   10,724 KB
goal_setting.avi         29,296 KB
my_inspiration.avi       12,143 KB
photo_library.avi        5,064 KB
strength_training.avi    31,723 KB
swimming_for_life.avi    29,133 KB
the_making.avi           94,428 KB
the_start.avi            13,364 KB
the_stroke.avi           36,953 KB
the_turn.avi             10,035 KB
travel.avi               36,616 KB
warm_up.avi              8,633 KB

If you want everything on the DVD because you really love Ian Thorpe then BUY the DVD and get the top quality and complete work and maybe it'll put a few bucks in the swimmer's pocket.

You will note a clear difference between his demonstrated practice stroke and his stroke during an actual competition.

The video quality of the DVD is excellent and the menus are clever and beautiful. The audio is really great.
